snippet: Frank R. Lautenberg’s death has left Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey with the chance to give away a Senate seat, but the decision is fraught with pitfalls.
abstract: Death of Sen Frank Lautenberg leaves New Jersey Gov Chris Christie with chance to give away seat in United States Senate, kind of opportunity that politicians usually covet; Christie's decision, however, is fraught with pitfalls, none bigger than having to choose between improving his party's fortunes in Washington and furthering his own political ambitions at home.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HALBFINGER, JEREMY W. PETERS and KATE ZERNIKE

lead_paragraph: Frank R. Lautenberg’s death has left Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey with the chance to give away a Senate seat, but the decision is fraught with pitfalls.

headline.seo: Death of Senator Places Chris Christie in Difficult Spot
headline.main: Death of Senator Places Christie in Difficult Spot
headline.print_headline: Death of Senator Places Christie in Difficult Spot
